summary: This document is a series of forwarded emails from whistleblower Chris Dilorio to various SEC officials, judges, and others, dated from 2020-2021. It contains detailed allegations of SEC corruption, obstruction, and facilitation of financial fraud involving entities like Knight Capital (NITE/Virtu), UBS, and various OTC market shells. Dilorio claims his whistleblower information was used by the SEC to bring actions but he was corruptly denied awards, and that the SEC protects key players like Richard Handler and Jefferies.

persons.name: Chris Dilorio
persons.context: Author of the emails, making extensive allegations of SEC corruption, obstruction of his whistleblower claims, and facilitation of fraud involving Knight Capital/NITE, UBS, and OTC shells.

persons.name: Christian Sabella
persons.role: Former SEC Associate Director/Director of Trading and Markets
persons.context: Described as a key player in the criminal obstruction of a thorough investigation of Dilorio's claims and having intimate knowledge of massive fraud.

persons.name: David Saltiel
persons.role: SEC Acting Director of Trading and Markets
persons.context: Named as acting director replacing Christian Sabella in a SEC press release.

persons.name: Brett Redfearn
persons.context: Mentioned as having mentored Christian Sabella at the SEC, and previously worked at JP Morgan.

persons.name: Douglas Cifu
persons.context: CEO of NITE/Virtu Financial; accused of admitting his firm under-reports illegal activity, misleading the public, and being central to the alleged fraud and merger with KCG.

persons.name: Richard Handler
persons.context: CEO of Jefferies; alleged to have a corrupt, criminal relationship with the SEC, and to be a primary beneficiary of frauds related to Knight Capital/KCG.

persons.name: William D. Duhnke III
persons.context: Removed from the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (PCAOB) by the SEC.

persons.name: Duane M. DesParte
persons.context: Named as acting chair of the PCAOB after Duhnke's removal.

persons.name: Janey Norberg
persons.context: SEC official accused of corruptly denying Dilorio a whistleblower award and creating extraordinary reasons for denial.

persons.name: Robin Traxler
persons.context: FINRA official with whom Dilorio had extensive interactions prior to filing his 2013 TCR.

persons.name: James Painter
persons.role: Owner of Emerging Market Solutions LLC
persons.context: Runs a pump-and-dump firm known to the SEC and SDNY courts; involved in promoting various fraud stocks.

persons.name: Virginia K. Sourlis
persons.context: Attorney against whom the SEC brought an enforcement action for aiding and abetting securities violations.

persons.name: Miriam Goldman Cedarbaum
persons.context: SDNY judge who granted the SEC summary judgment against Virginia Sourlis.

persons.name: Jim Abate
persons.context: Managing director at Centre Asset Management, sharing a virtual office address with James Painter.

persons.name: Curt Kramer
persons.context: Described as a prolific 'bag man' involved in several money laundering shells mentioned in Dilorio's TCRs.

persons.name: Frederick Lehrer
persons.context: Attorney involved in SEC-approved offerings for companies promoted by Painter's firm.

persons.name: Steven Gribben
persons.context: Former chief counsel at COR Clearing, a firm fined by the SEC for failing to report suspicious penny stock trading.

persons.name: Ebrahim Daoud Nonoo
persons.context: Bahraini businessman and new 'bag man' involved with AppTech (APCX), a money laundering shell.

persons.name: Jay Clayton
persons.context: SEC Chair accused of conflicts of interest related to Sullivan & Cromwell and NITE, and of facilitating fraud.

persons.name: Jared Fishman
persons.context: Sullivan & Cromwell colleague of Jay Clayton, accused of playing a key role in keeping NITE/Virtu running.

persons.name: Glenn Hutchins
persons.role: Co-founder of Silver Lake, former Blackstone
persons.context: Co-founder of Silver Lake, former Blackstone, friend of Jay Clayton, and through North Island, a top shareholder in NITE/Virtu.

persons.name: Robert Greifeld
persons.context: Former NASDAQ CEO, former director of Automated Securities Clearance Ltd (sold to SunGard), co-founded North Island with Hutchins.

persons.name: Adena Friedman
persons.context: NASDAQ CEO who signed off on NASDAQ's acquisition of the BRUT ECN from SunGard.

persons.name: Dan Kamensky
persons.context: Individual facing criminal charges in an SDNY case that Dilorio claims is a fraud and set-up to protect Handler/Jefferies.

persons.name: Preet Bharara
persons.context: Former SDNY U.S. Attorney who was in possession of Dilorio's information.

persons.name: Richard Blostein
persons.context: Goldman Sachs analyst covering NITE/Virtu; accused of knowing but not disclosing the importance of OTC share volumes to NITE's revenue.

persons.name: Michael Repetto
persons.context: Sell-side analyst (likely at Jefferies) questioned about his coverage of NITE and relationship with Handler/Jefferies.

persons.name: Joshua Sason
persons.context: Bag man involved in Hanover/Magna and various shells; subject of an SEC complaint based on Dilorio's information.

persons.name: Justin Keener
persons.context: Bag man involved with JMJ in fraudulent convertible notes; barred by FINRA as a 'Bad Actor' but still active in shells like Blink Charging.

persons.name: Ajay Tandon
persons.context: Co-founder of SeeThruEquity, a research firm sued by the SEC for pump-and-dump schemes involving Net Element (NETE).

persons.name: Amit Tandon
persons.context: Co-founder of SeeThruEquity, a research firm sued by the SEC for pump-and-dump schemes involving Net Element (NETE).

connections.description: Dilorio is a whistleblower whose award applications were denied by Norberg at the SEC OWB, which he alleges was corrupt and obstructive.
Sabella was mentored at the SEC by Brett Redfearn, who previously worked at JP Morgan.
Handler (Jefferies) and Cifu (NITE/Virtu) are alleged to have collaborated with the SEC in fraudulent mergers and cover-ups, with Jefferies as a major KCG shareholder.
Clayton is described as a good friend of Glenn Hutchins, a relationship that may represent a conflict of interest.
Hutchins and Greifeld co-founded North Island, which became a top shareholder in NITE/Virtu.
Both share a virtual office address at 48 Wall Street, Suite 1100 in New York.
Dilorio alleges Kamensky's criminal case is a fraud and set-up orchestrated to protect Handler and Jefferies.
Dilorio is a persistent whistleblower alleging massive corruption, obstruction, and facilitation of fraud within the SEC.

events.title: SEC Announces Leadership Change in Trading and Markets
events.description: The SEC announces David Saltiel as Acting Director of Trading and Markets, replacing Christian Sabella who departs the agency.

events.title: SEC Removes PCAOB Chair
events.description: The SEC removes William D. Duhnke III from the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (PCAOB) and appoints Duane M. DesParte as Acting Chair.

events.title: Filing of Knight Capital TCR
events.description: Chris Dilorio files a TCR (Tip, Complaint or Referral) with Berger Montague concerning Knight Capital (NITE) and UBS related to money laundering shells APCX and CGFIA.

events.title: Knight Capital 'Glitch'
events.description: Knight Capital suffers a massive trading 'glitch' causing huge losses, which Dilorio alleges was proof of Knight's insolvency due to abusive naked shorting and the start of a cover-up.

events.title: Virtu Financial Acquisition of KCG Holdings
events.description: Virtu Financial acquires KCG Holdings in a $1.4 billion all-cash transaction. Dilorio alleges the deal was fraudulent, using inflated tangible book value based on fraud assets, and involved a $4+ billion write-down of naked short fails just before closing.

events.title: SEC UBS AML Action
events.description: The SEC brings an anti-money laundering action against UBS, which Dilorio claims was based on his information but for which he was corruptly denied an award.

events.title: AppTech Partnership with NEC Payments
events.description: AppTech (APCX), a money laundering shell per Dilorio, announces a digital banking partnership with NEC Payments, a Bahraini entity, involving businessman Ebrahim Daoud Nonoo.

events.title: SDNY Criminal Case Against Dan Kamensky
events.description: The SDNY brings a criminal case against Dan Kamensky related to Neiman Marcus bankruptcy. Dilorio claims this is a fraudulent set-up to protect Richard Handler and Jefferies.

locations: 48 Wall Street, Suite 1100, New York, NY 10005
keyFacts: Chris Dilorio, a whistleblower, alleges the SEC has engaged in criminal obstruction and corruption to protect entities like Knight Capital/NITE/Virtu, UBS, and various OTC market shells from investigation.

Dilorio claims his TCR information was used by the SEC and FINRA to bring enforcement actions (e.g., against UBS, Sason, Keener) but he was corruptly denied whistleblower awards by officials like Janey Norberg.

A central allegation is a corrupt relationship between the SEC, Richard Handler/Jefferies, and Douglas Cifu/NITE to facilitate fraudulent mergers and cover up the core business of abusive naked shorting of OTC shells for money laundering.

The document details a network of individuals and firms (e.g., James Painter, Joshua Sason, Justin Keener, Curt Kramer) involved in promoting and operating alleged money laundering shells and pump-and-dump schemes.

Dilorio asserts that key events like the 2012 Knight 'glitch' and the 2017 Virtu-KCG merger were cover-ups for insolvency caused by illegal naked shorting, facilitated by the SEC and connected parties like JP Morgan and Goldman Sachs.
